title: Poster, Modernism Gone Wild, 1985
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
signed: Imprinted lower left corner: AIGA Boston thanks yous[sic] for: Color Separations: / Publishers Choice / Printing: / Chadis Printing Co. Inc. / Paper: / Rourke - Eno Paper Company, Boston / Typesetting: / Typographic House, Inc. / Design: / CP & DF
inscribed:
Imprinted in white upper left: Dan Friedman sees the / radical and often wild / evolution of his work / as a reaction to the / idealism and limitations / of his modernist / training. In his slide / lecture, he will explain / those issues and / transformations which / have been the basis for / his art, design and life / style over the past 15 years.
Thursday, December 5 / 7:30 pm, Room D / Harvard Science Center / 1 Oxford Street / Cambridge, next to / Sanders Theater and a 4-minute walk from  / the Harvard Squard T.

At right center a quote from the artist. 
Verso: in black on white lower left: direct mail informationand map to lecture.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: On a black background on black and white photographic reproduction of the Typographie poster, designed by Friedman in 1970, placed above a color image of an interior of Friedman's apartment in 1985. At upper left a yellow arrow points to a block of white text. At right center a small block of white text. At lower left, biographical information about the artist. At the bottom of the sheet at center in gray AIGA/Boston, followed by 12.5.80 in yellow. Upper center right, also in gray: 'Dan Friedman:' followed by 'Modernism Gone Wild' in yellow.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, Modernism Gone Wild, 1985. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-426
